intro: Polygala timoutoides, commonly known as the Timbuktu milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, bean-like fruits that contain seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
